definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The boss kicked Tom out of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 老板把汤姆踢出工厂大门。

sentences.english: At the brand new Starbucks store a long queue of people spilled onto the street.
sentences.chinese: 人们把崭新的星巴克大门围得水泄不通。

sentences.english: A group of armed guards have arrived and are waiting outside the gate.
sentences.chinese: 一队武装警卫抵达并守卫在牢房区大门处。

sentences.english: Four gossips were chatting in a doorway.
sentences.chinese: 四个老婆子聚在一家大门口聊天。

sentences.english: It was, for him, as though the rock were a giant hard door into another world.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得那岩石像是通往另外世界的一扇坚实大门。

sentences.english: A truck brings in a delivery in through a wide, slow-moving gate.
sentences.chinese: 一辆卡车通过一扇宽阔的缓慢开启的大门运送物资。

sentences.english: Cardboard boxes for the tenements, doors and windows painstankingly detailed with coloured pens.
sentences.chinese: 用水彩笔描绘的纸板箱是用来装公寓，大门和窗户的。

sentences.english: The visitor hammered against the door with his fists.
sentences.chinese: 来访者用拳头使劲地锤打着大门。

sentences.english: But in the 59th minute, Corradi attacks the worn-out host front door tying score.
sentences.chinese: 而在第59分钟，科拉迪攻破旧主大门追平比分。

sentences.english: Longevity here both sides of this gate.
sentences.chinese: 在说这大门两侧的福星和寿星。

sentences.english: Pinyin is like a kind of 'Open sesame,' opening up the doors," he says.
sentences.chinese: 拼音就像“芝麻开门”，为人们敞开了大门”他说。

sentences.english: In high school the door, unfamiliar environment like hell.
sentences.chinese: 踏入高中那扇大门，陌生的环境犹如地狱般可怕。

sentences.english: Hanging a gourd on the wall next to your front door is thought to bring wealth and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在大门口旁可以挂上一个葫芦，一般认为可招财纳福。

sentences.english: Li-Jieli's story gives us a look behind the factory gates.
sentences.chinese: 李洁丽向我们展开了工厂大门后的故事。

sentences.english: I walk around and around the carved stone gates to the library garden.
sentences.chinese: 我绕着通往图书馆花园的石雕大门走了一圈又一圈。

sentences.english: RECEPTIONIST: The staff room is near the main entrance, on the left over there, just opposite the Reception desk.
sentences.chinese: 研究室在大门旁边，在那左边，咨询处的对面。

definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to get sth open by tapping or striking it/(figuratively, when followed by sth like ∼的大門|∼的大门) to open the door to ~/to gain access to ~
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
